What is the Euler characteristic of the tangent bundle on the projective space $\mathbb{RP}^n$?

Hint: Recall that the Euler characteristic of a vector bundle $E$ over a space $X$ is defined as $\chi(X,E) = \sum_{i=0}^n (-1)^i \operatorname{rank}(H_i(X,E))$, where $n$ is the dimension of $X$.
message_2:
To compute the Euler characteristic of the tangent bundle on the projective space $\mathbb{RP}^n$, we first need to understand the cohomology of the tangent bundle. Recall that the tangent bundle of $\mathbb{RP}^n$ is given by $T\mathbb{RP}^n \cong \mathbb{RP}^n \times \mathbb{R}^{n+1} / \sim$, where $(x,v) \sim (x,-v)$ for $x \in \mathbb{RP}^n$ and $v \in \mathbb{R}^{n+1}$.

Now, consider the short exact sequence of vector bundles over $\mathbb{RP}^n$:

$$0 \to T\mathbb{RP}^n \to \mathbb{RP}^n \times \mathbb{R}^{n+1} \to \mathbb{RP}^n \times \mathbb{R}^{n+1} / T\mathbb{RP}^n \to 0$$

This short exact sequence induces a long exact sequence in cohomology:

$$\cdots \to H^i(\mathbb{RP}^n, T\mathbb{RP}^n) \to H^i(\mathbb{RP}^n, \mathbb{RP}^n \times \mathbb{R}^{n+1}) \to H^i(\mathbb{RP}^n, \mathbb{RP}^n \times \mathbb{R}^{n+1} / T\mathbb{RP}^n) \to H^{i+1}(\mathbb{RP}^n, T\mathbb{RP}^n) \to \cdots$$

Since $\mathbb{RP}^n \times \mathbb{R}^{n+1}$ is a trivial bundle, we have $H^i(\mathbb{RP}^n, \mathbb{RP}^n \times \mathbb{R}^{n+1}) \cong H^i(\mathbb{RP}^n, \mathbb{R})$. Moreover, $\mathbb{RP}^n \times \mathbb{R}^{n+1} / T\mathbb{RP}^n$ is a line bundle, so its cohomology is determined by the first Stiefel-Whitney class $w_1(\mathbb{RP}^n \times \mathbb{R}^{n+1} / T\mathbb{RP}^n) = w_1(T\mathbb{RP}^n)$. Since $w_1(T\mathbb{RP}^n) \neq 0$, we have $H^i(\mathbb{RP}^n, \mathbb{RP}^n \times \mathbb{R}^{n+1} / T\mathbb{RP}^n) = 0$ for $i > 0$.

Now, we can compute the Euler characteristic of the tangent bundle:

$$\chi(\mathbb{RP}^n, T\mathbb{RP}^n) = \sum_{i=0}^n (-1)^i \operatorname{rank}(H_i(\mathbb{RP}^n, T\mathbb{RP}^n))$$

Since $H^i(\mathbb{RP}^n, T\mathbb{RP}^n) = 0$ for $i > 0$, we have:

$$\chi(\mathbb{RP}^n, T\mathbb{RP}^n) = \operatorname{rank}(H_0(\mathbb{RP}^n, T\mathbb{RP}^n)) = \operatorname{rank}(H^0(\mathbb{RP}^n, T\mathbb{RP}^n))$$

Now, $H^0(\mathbb{RP}^n, T\mathbb{RP}^n)$ is the space of global sections of the tangent bundle, which is isomorphic to the space of vector fields on $\mathbb{RP}^n$. Since $\mathbb{RP}^n$ is compact and orientable for even $n$, it admits a nowhere-vanishing vector field if and only if $n$ is even. Thus, we have:

$$\chi(\mathbb{RP}^n, T\mathbb{RP}^n) = \begin{cases} 1 & \text{if } n \text{ is even} \\ 0 & \text{if } n \text{ is odd} \end{cases}$$
